column4: okies: i need some serious help with partitioning. I've got ubuntu installed on my main hard disk, but i need to make a small XP compatable partition, enough space for the XP start-up files. (I'm attempting to instal XP on my secondary hard drive)
Anyone able to give advice to a releative newb?
I don't think your plan will work. Putting Windows on the first hard disk drive is much easier.
i'd really like the larger disk (the one that's got ubuntu on it already) to remain the primary disk if at all possible
